div.p: Symmetrical and asymmetrical maps were recorded at different wavelengths. Figure 1 shows the ( 004) and ( 224) maps of sample #5441. From RSMs the strain distribution as a function of the Ge content of the buffer layer was obtained (Fig. 2) showing efficient strain relaxation as required for subsequent growth of strained Si-channels for two dimensional electron gas confinement. The strain distribution in this particular sample deviates, however, from the usual pattern known fi-om similar, MBE grown samples. This might be due to an overshoot in the feedback control of the Ge source during sample growth. figure.figDesc: Two types of Si-based heterostructures have been investigated during this beam time. Reciprocal space maps (RSMs) of partially relaxed, graded Sii,Ge, buffer layers grown by Low Energy DC-Plasma Enhanced Chemical Vapor Deposition (LEPECVD) have been measured using a position sensitive detector (PSD) setup. These samples were provided by ETH Zurich within the framework of an ESPRIT-project (LOCO).'.2
